questionTitle: They have ________ the old castle and it is now a luxury hotel.
I ________ so much last night: I feel terrible.
He stole one of the officers' uniforms and managed to escape by passing himself ________ as a guard.
________ we set off in the next few minutes, we'll be there in time.
If he drinks any more beer, I don't think he'll be ________ to play this afternoon.
My employer's ________ of my work does not matter to me at all.
The recent ________ violence is worrying the police.
We're in good time; there's ________ to hurry.
The police ________ the kidnapper from escaping by blocking all exits.
This meat isn't suitable ________.
A railway bridge is already ________ over the river.
The pictures is ________; the thief will be most disappointed when he tries to sell it!
Even though he is thirty-five, he lives ________ his mother and is completely dependent on her.
It should be obvious ________ you that if you persist in bothering him, he will get angry with you.
He often forgets to do what he has been told and is scolded for being ________.
The room is quite hot. The oil heater gives ________.
In the middle of our trip we stopped ________ a rest on the river bank.
The judge, after ruling that the article had unjustly ________ the reputation of the architect, ordered the magazine to ________ its libelous statements in print.
When he heard the news he went completely ________.
I won't ________ those children making a noise in my house!
